name: PLACE MATS: vintage Jell-O
description:
What could be yummier?

Set of six laminated, stitched place mats, made in Vermont for Small Equals. Each image is a high resolution scan from recipe books in the Liza Cowan ephemera archives. 

Wipe clean with damp cloth. Double sided, same image front and back.

Limited edition, made to order. Please allow two weeks for delivery.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Tibor Gergely, The Chief Is On the Way
description: Tibor Gergely, Hungarian Jewish artist probably most famous for his wonderful illustrations for Golden Books, is my inspiration for a series of Keepsake Boxes. I use tattered old books, and yes, some of them are still being published after all these years,. I make the pages into the covers of the boxes. Iâ€™m fascinated by the power and beauty of the Gergely illustrations at the moment. Each box is hand made in Vermont of Vermont pine. aprox 5x7x1 this box can hold small toy and game pieces, buttons, petty cash, or any smallish treasure. Perfect as a gift, fits right inside a USPO small flat rate ship box for easy sending.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: vintage seed catalog, sweet pea
description: Charming detail from an old seed catalog. Fill this with candied violets, a package of seeds, old love letters. Your imagination is the limit. Great as a gift: the bloom never fades. Aprox 5x7, fits into a small USPO Ship Box.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Japanese Matchbox label flower
description: This charming print makes a lovely box for keeping seeds, jewelry, petty cash, hairpins...you name it. Perfect gift for any occasion, the blooms never fade. Made one by one in Vermont of Vermont pine, with paper image decoupaged onto the lid. We do our best to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Lily of The Valley
description: Why give a bunch of flowers, when for almost the same price - and much smaller environmental impact - you can give a Keepsake flower box? The blooms never fade. Fill it with candy, seedbombs from VisuaLigual, jewelry, a card, or any small thing you like. Made one by one in Vermont of Vermont pine, with paper image decoupaged onto the lid. We do our best to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Seed catalog, hybrid roses.
description: Looking for a place to stash sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. Lid features an image of hybrid roses from a 1898 Seed Catalog 5 x 7 x 1.5 Vermont-made wooden box.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Trumpet Vine.
description: This keepsake box features a Liza Cowan photograph of a trumpet vine. Each Vermont-Made wooden box has a sliding top, for filling with small goodies. Fits right into a $5.00 flat rate ship box from US PO for perfectly easy gift giving. Here's a video I made about the boxes. Please excuse the mirror image.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Angus and the Cat
description: A childhood favorite, Angus And The Cat by Marjorie Flack. The image on this box is the cover of a tattered old copy of the book. Watch the beloved scottie dog chase the cat, and fill the box with whatever small treats you want. Biscuits for your dog? Jewelry, ticket stubs, petty cash. Fill it up for gift giving and send it right inside a USPO small flat rate ship box for just about five bucks. Box is made by hand in Vermont using Vermont Pine. We try to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible using locally sourced or recycled elements.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Angus and the Cat, Back Cover
description: Who is the cutest Scottie Dog? Angus. Drawn and written by Marjorie Flack, this dog and his book has charmed readers for decades. Here is the back cover of the book, taken from a tattered old copy, on the sliding lid of a Vermont-made pine box ready to hold your dog treats, cat nip, loose change or whatever you like. Makes a perfect gift for the dog or cat lover in your life. Custom made to fit right inside a small USPO flat rate ship box. Fill it and send for only about five dollars.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Birds
description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. 6 x8 x 1/12 Vermont-made wooden box. Sliding lid features charming birds, to keep spring in your heart all year long. Fits neatly into a small flat-rate USPO ship box, so you can fill it up and still send it for only $5.25 Open box shown with Seed Bombs, also available here.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: dogs rule
description: If you love dogs as much as we do you will want to get this box to store dog biscuits, mad money, trinkets, photos, you name it. Makes a great gift for a dog lover too. Fits right into a USPO small flat rate ship box for easy gift giving. Fill it up and send for just over five bucks. Made one by one in Vermont of Vermont pine, with paper image decoupaged onto sliding lid. No children or dogs were exploited in the making of this box.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: vintage pugs
description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. 6x8x1 1/2 Vermont-made wooden box. Fits neatly into a USPO small flat rate box, so you can ship it filled with goodies for only $5.25

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Make Do And Mend
description: Looking for a place to stash sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. 5 x 7 x 1.5 Vermont-made wooden box. Lid features graphic from WW2 England, when conservation was a necessity and a patriotic duty. Pug Saki rests on some old fabric we are repurposing as a winter coat for her.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Sew To The Moon
description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. 5 x 7 x 1.5 Vermont-made wooden box. The sliding lid features a reproduction of a mid 20th Century needle pack from the Cowan Ephemera Collections. The image says "Made In Japan" because that's what the original needle pack said. The reproduction was made in Vermont, and the box was made in Vermont of Vermont pine.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Button Guy
description: Looking for a present that's cool, unique, and long lasting, but won't break the bank?? Look no further. This 5 x7 (aprox) Vermont-made wooden box with sliding top holds all kinds of cool things. Load it up with wrapped candies, trinkets, perfume...what ever you like. Or just give it plain. You can't go wrong. This dapper guy was a button card. You can see the original pearly buttons in the scan. Comes with greeting card of same image. It would be great as a sewing kit. Or whatever you fancy. Here's a little video I made about the boxes. Sorry about the mirror image.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Diamond Sharps
description: Looking for a present that's cool, unique, and long lasting, but won't break the bank?? Look no further. This 5 x7 Vermont-made wooden box with sliding top holds all kinds of cool things. Load it up or give it plain with the enclosed matching card. You can't go wrong. This box is decorated with an image from a mid 20th Century needle pack. It is ideal as a small sewing box or for holding an small items. We use ours for spools of thread, some needles, a little scissors and a bunch of safety pins. Pretty to look at, easy to use, and very very handy. Here's a little video I made about the boxes. Sorry about the mirror image.

description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. The sliding lid features a reproduction of a mid 20th Century needle pack from the Cowan Ephemera Collections. Want to fill it up and send it as a gift? Easy. Fits right into a USPO small ship box so it goes for $5.25 no matter what it weighs.

description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. description: Looking for a place to stash your first aid kit? Your sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. Want to fill it up and give it as a gift. You can choose something from this store, or fill it with your own goodies. Best of all, if you need to ship it, the box fits right into a small USPO flat rate box, so no matter how heavy, it ships for just $5.25.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Vintage Man's Head
description: This keepsake box features a reproduction of a vintage print of a man's head. Each Vermont-Made wooden box has a sliding top, for filling with small goodies. Fits right into a $5.00 flat rate ship box from US PO for perfectly easy gift giving.

description: Looking for a present that's cool, unique, and long lasting, but won't break the bank?? Look no further. You can't go wrong. This vintage medical illustration would make a great get well soon present, or for a medical professional, or just a cool thing for anyone who loves ephemera, vintage illustration, or groovy guys. Here's a little video I made about the boxes. Sorry about the mirror image.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Liza Matisse
description: One of my favorite boxes, the image on this is The Roumanian Blouse by LIza Matisse from my series FAKE! Paintings by Liza Matisse, Liza Leger and Liza Picasso. Made of Vermont Pine, aprox 5x7. A great way to combine art and organization. Sits neatly on a shelf or lies flat anywhere. Fill it, give it, enjoy it.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Amazons
description: From a Greek Vase, Amazons on horseback. Indulge that classics lover with this ancient image. Perfect for stashing any small goods from seeds to jewelry to mad money. Or give as a gift to the wonder woman in your life. Made one-by-one in Vermont of Vermont Pine. Lid image made of paper decoupaged to sliding wooden lid. We do our best to keep our carbon footprint small by using locally sourced or recycled elements.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Lactated food Wells Richardson & Co
description: Looking for a place to stash some art supplies? Sewing supplies? Or anything? Or looking for a great gift that you can give as is, or fill with whatever small things you like. We love these as sewing boxes, but anything goes. Here it is. 5 x 7 x 1.5 Vermont-made wooden box. The sliding lid features a reproduction of a turn of the century trade card from Wells Richardson & Co. Burlington Vermont. At the end of the 19th Century, Wells Richardson & Company patented, manufactured and distributed analyne dyes under the name of Diamond Dyes, as well as butter dye, baby food and proprietary medicines like Celery Compound. Print Advertising was a part of their marketing strategy. Before the advent of color ads in newspapers and magazines manufacturers and distributors relied on trade cards and medical pamphlets -featuring their own cures - to sell their products. These they made by the gajillion, and distributed nationwide. They would be distributed for free in retail stores or any public venue where they might drum up business. Trade cards were hugely collectible, even in those days, and would often end up in scrapbooks, which were also the rage. The trade cards and pamphlets were printed by chromolithography, and retain their brilliant colors to this day. This dye-cut card advertising their baby formula. Before the Pure Food and Drug act of 1906 anyone could sell anything. There were no ingredient labels, and there is no telling what was really in this product. This would make a cute baby-shower gift.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: leave a message
description:
Keep stuff AND have a way to leave a quick message. I need that, don't you? You can keep the chalk right inside for when you are ready to leave a note. Or stash paper clips, pens, eyeglasses, post-its or whatever you want.

6 x8 x 1/12 Vermont-made wooden box fits right inside a USPO small ship box so you can send it filled for only $5.25.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Diamond Dyes Easter Egg
description: Love to give a little something for Easter, Oester, Ostara? Here's a gift that keeps on giving. A box with a charming graphic from a late 19th Century trade card from Wells Richardson & Co, Diamond Dyes. Fill it with candy eggs, soaps (as shown here) or even some seeds for the coming planting season. You can't go wrong with this lovely box. Made in Vermont from Vermont pine with graphic decoupaged to the sliding lid.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: A Thrilling Halloween
description:
When  you want to give a special Halloween gift, prize, stash...who do you call? Ghost Busters? No...call Small Equals. We've got the perfect box for you.

And when the candy is gone...the box is perfect for storing all kinds of small goods from paperclips to sewing stuff to stationery supplies to whatever you need to keep.

Candy not included (I don't know what kind of candy you like. These are special Kisses, I got them at the supermarket. Very sophisticated)

5 x 7 x 1 &1/2 (aprox), this fits right into a USPO small ship box so you can send it, filled or not, for only $5.25.

name: KEEPSAKE BOX: Halloween, The Owl and Witch
description:
This box is perfect for Halloween treats. Think of them as a prize for an apple bob, or a housewarming present, or a way to say a special thank you at a special time of year. Having a give-away or door prizes for your school or charity? Perfect. Fill them with candies or other little treats (or tricks.)  And after the candy's gone, they  are great to stash all around the house for all you small goods, so don't feel shy about buying a few for yourself. 

Candy not included. (I don't know what kind you like!)

5x7 1/2 by 1 1/2. These fit right into a USPO ship box, so you can send them filled, for only $5.25

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTIONS: Nesco
description: I had one of these at my gallery and there were two reactions: "I grew up with one of these." or "what the heck..???" It's a cooker, and what I learned from folks here in Vermont is that usually it would sit on the porch to be used for holidays when there were too many roasts or whatever to stuff into the regular oven. Anyway, they are so wonderful looking. I took the heating element out of mine and used it as a bar for openings. Filled the top with ice. But I'm not selling the actual stove here...just the ad for it. So cool. What a great piece for a kitchen, right? Fine-art laminated on high density wood board by Silver Maple Editions in Burlington to give it a very sophisticated look, quite well protected. Keyhole on the back for easy hanging. A pushpin will do the trick. 9 1/2 x 13 x 1/4. What a beauty.

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTIONS: Heinz Cider Vinegar
description: "It is Flavor, the Soul of the Salad." From a Saturday Evening Post, 1925, this beautifully illustrated ad for Heinz pure cider vinegar will fit right into any kitchen. Fine-art laminated on high-density wood by Silver Maple Editions in Burlington VT. Sleek, waterproof and lightweight, a keyhole opening in the back makes it easy to hang. 10 x 13 1/2 x 1/4

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTIONS: Heinz Baked Beans
description: From the Saturday Evening Post 1925, perfect for a food lover or kitchens of all kinds. Heinz Oven Baked Beans. Yum. Fine art laminated on high-density wood board by Burlington VT company Silver Maple Editions. Sleek, matte, unobtrusive, protected and easy to hang on the keyhole mount. A pushpin will do the trick. 10 x 13 1/2 x 1/4 Image from the Liza Cowan Ephemera Collections.

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTIONS: Heinz Peanut Butter
description: I didn't even know Heinz made peanut butter until I found this 1925 Saturday Evening Post ad. Now available in reproduction to suit any kitchen, or any peanut butter lover. Fine-art laminated on high-density wood by SilverMaple Editons in Burlington in a process that Burlingtonians always call "silvermaplizing." Contemporary, sleek, durable, lightweight, with a keyhole at the back for very easy hanging. Really, a push pin will hold it. 10 x 13 1/2 x 1/4.

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTIONS: Diamond Dyes Egg
description: From an old advertising pamphlet from Wells, Richardson & Co., the famous Burlington, Vermont company that made Diamond Dyes, butter dyes, and patent medicines. From the Liza Cowan Ephemera Collections. 9 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 1/4 This is a detail showing children dying eggs with Diamond Dyes. Fine art laminated on high-density wood board by Burlington Vermont company Silver Maple Editions. Around here we call the process "silvermaplizing" The finish is matte, with a keyhole mount on the back. Simple, elegant presentation, ready for hanging.

name: EPHEMERA REPRODUCTION: dog from old coloring book
description: These charming dogs are from an early 20th century coloring book. A child from long ago has almost colored within the lines. From the Liza Cowan Ephemera Collections 6 1/2 x 10 x .1/4 inches. Fine art laminated by Silver Maple Editions on high-density wood board with keyhole in back for easy hanging. Really, all you need is a pushpin and this beauty is ready to go. Sleek and stylish, this will delight any dog lover.

name: MARY LOUISE SPOOR: Schoolroom poster 1917. Hickory Dickory Dock
description:
Schoolroom poster of Hickory Dickory Dock.
Triptych. Three images in a row illustrating the nursery rhyme.
size: 54 x 20 inches. Single sided. No text.
Very good condition. Some small tears at edges.
Perfect for a child's room. They will never outgrow this poster. If they do, it will be temporary and you can move it to the living room until they are old enough to appreciate it again. This is an heirloom gift for anyone as it will only increase in value. 


Mary Louise Spoor (1887-1985) worked for a brief shining moment from Chicago, publishing illustrations for Rand McNally and Lyons & Carnihan.  Mollie, as she was called, went to The Art Institute  and shared a studio with Gertrude Spaller, another young illustrator. Together they illustrated two children's readers. The Easy Road To Reading Primer editions one and two.

In 1917 she published  a set of three schoolroom posters of nursery rhymes with Congdon Publishers in Chicago.

By 1917 she was married and pregnant with her first child. She moved to Massachussets to raise her family. And that ended her professional career. She continued painting and drawing private works that would end up in family collections but those works have not yet entered into public circulation. 

For more on ML Spoor see my blog <a href="http://bit.ly/bizdJH">click HERE</a

name: MARY LOUISE SPOOR: 1917 Schoolroom Poster. Bye Baby Bunting/Jack and Jill
description:
Double sided schoolroom poster of Bye Baby Bunting/Jack and Jill.
Printed in 1917. Quality is very good. Colors have faded a bit in the past 100 years and there is very slight tearing along the edge. 
Size: 54 x 38 inches with text. 
Bye Baby Bunting on one side, Jack and Jill on the reverse.

This is an heirloom quality gift for anyone of any age. Perfect for a child's room, but also wonderful in an adult living room. Children are never too young to be looking at good art. If they temporarily grow out of it, the picture can be moved to another room until they are old enough to appreciate it again, both for its beauty and it's ever increasing value.


Mary Louise Spoor (1887-1985) worked for a brief shining moment from Chicago, publishing illustrations for Rand McNally and Lyons & Carnihan.  Mollie, as she was called, went to The Art Institute  and shared a studio with Gertrude Spaller, another young illustrator. Together they illustrated two children's readers. The Easy Road To Reading Primer editions one and two.

In 1917 she published  a set of three schoolroom posters of nursery rhymes with Congdon Publishers in Chicago.

By 1917 she was married and pregnant with her first child. She moved to Massachussets to raise her family. And that ended her professional career. She continued painting and drawing private works that would end up in family collections but those works have not yet entered into public circulation. 

For more on ML Spoor see my blog <a href="http://bit.ly/bizdJH">click HERE</a

name: SEED BOMBS: wildflower variety for Northeast
description:
Practice random acts of gardening with these seed bombs! Five gumball-sized balls are packed into each 3 x 4 1/2-inch pouch, ready for gift-giving. We screenprint each pouch with the design. Inside each pouch is the full list of the seeds included. When you've used up the seed bombs, reuse the pouch or frame it!

The bird-, bee- and butterfly-friendly flower mixture includes Baby Blue Eyes, Babyâ€™s Breath, Black Eye Susan, Blue Flax, California Poppy, Cornflower, Gloriosa Daisy, Lance-Leaf Coreopsis, Mexican Hat, None-so Pretty, Perennial Gaillardia, Perennial Lupine, Plains Coreopsis, Purple Coneflower, Red Poppy, Rose Mallow, Scarlet Flax, Shasta Daisy, Siberian Wallflower, Sulphur Cosmos, Sweet William, Wild Annual Sunflower, Wild Cosmos, and Wild Larkspur.

Seed bombs can be planted in the Spring, Summer and early Fall -- just throw and grow! The ball will break up on impact with the ground, and rain will further disintegrate it. The red clay and worm castings in the seed bombs enrich the soil around the seeds, helping your wildflowers grow. You can purchase this item during the Fall and Winter months -- just remember to keep the seed bombs cool, dark and dry until all danger of frost has passed in the Spring, and then throw them as usual.

name: PHOTO PRINT: Zinc, from Shipyard Archeology
description: ZINC, by Liza Cowan. From the series Shipyard Archeology. A Zinc is a piece of actual zinc bolted to the hull of a ship to prevent the buildup of electrolites. The blue is the paint on the ship, with a patch (the black part) scraped off to reveal the raw underside of the hull. Photo taken in Greenport, New York at a working shipyard. image is 4.5x6.5 printed on 8.5 x 11 paper made from 100% post- consumer recycled fiber. Signed in pencil by artist. The printed name, copyright symbol and border do NOT appear on the actual print. Looks great in a Canetti 5x7 frame, available at this shop.

name: PHOTO PRINT: Portrait of Poor Pitiful Pearl
description: William Steig designed Poor Pitiful Pearl in 1958, and she was an instant classic. This portrait of Pearl by Liza Cowan is available as a color print The copyright, name and border are NOT on the print. Image size 4.5 x 5.5. on paper made from 100% post consumer recycled fiber. Easily mats to 5x7. Looks perfect in a 5x7 Canetti Magnet Frame, which we also sell CLICK HERE Read more about Pearl and William Steig CLICK HERE

name: MAGNET FRAME: by Canetti , 5x7 Clear
description:
Two slices of pure acrylic, held together by tiny powerful magnets, these frames are as good as they get. Sleek, modern, and beautiful. The frame is 5x7, and looks great either filled to the edge or with your image floating.  Made to stand on its own, this frame does not hang. Looks great on a shelf, table, piano, or any flat surface.

 Framing small pictures has never been so easy.

name: MAGNET- DYKE IS OUT! ARE YOU?
description: In 1976 I published and edited a Lesbian Feminist cultural theory magazine called DYKE A Quarterly. Now 35 years later, I have launched an online annotated archive of the magazine and collateral ephemera. This image was our first flier. It was taken in a fashion photographer's studio and it features me, Liza, owner of Small Equals, my editorial partner Penny, and three of our pals, including the now famous singer Alix Dobkin, whose memoir, My Red Blood, was published recently and is fascinating. Many of the archive readers have expressed enthusiasm about having this image on some sort of media, and I decided that a magnet was most appropriate. The archive has some costs associated with it, so the magnet is also a fundraiser. Help support an archive, keep history thriving, and buy something cool.
